item.title: New Scholarly Communication Expert Pages
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
This month we launched the new and improved Scholarly Communication expert pages on the library website. As part of an ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service, we looked at usage patterns on the existing pages and collaborated with Anneliese to gather the most important tasks, messages, and pieces of information. The ...

item.title: Updating Web Content
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
As most of you realize, the library’s web presence is not just a single site, though we try to make things as seamless as possible for users. The UX Team has recently been taking stock and strategizing about how to make things more consistent, as well as easier for content ...

item.title: Faculty Support and Multimedia Expert Pages
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
In addition to the newly launched Data Science pages, this week we launched new Ask an Expert pages for Faculty Support and Multimedia Hardware and Software as part of the greater Ask an Expert redesign. The goal of this redesign is to simplify and streamline content and emphasize the human-centered ...

item.description:

item.title: LibGuides Improvements
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Sophia has been assessing and identifying ways to spruce up our guides. She’s primarily working with the Education group to come up with some best practices and ways to improve content, but much of what comes out of the process will be helpful to all of us. A few steps ...

item.title: Content Audit Results
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Back in February, the Web Projects Team put out a call for volunteers to help with a content audit of every page of library.ucsf.edu. There was a great response, and using methods outlined at LibUX, the group did a comprehensive inventory and objective evaluation that will be instrumental to guiding improvements over the next ...

item.title: Lean and Mean
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Both Group Study Rooms and Faculty Carrels recently went on a text diet. The result is that the key points are still there, but the amount of content on those pages has been trimmed significantly. Since the streamlined version is short and to-the-point, it’s much more likely to be read ...
